p: ZIKV infectious particles were detected in all blood meals provided to mosquitoes and those blood meal titers were the following: experiment 1, 8.6 log10 plaque-forming units (PFU)/ml; experiment 2, 8.0 log 10 PFU/ml; and experiment 3: 8.4 log 10 PFU/ml. Additionally, we assayed several positive day 0 mosquitoes and detected infectious ZIKV, indicating that mosquitoes imbibed infectious blood. A summary of sample sizes and transmission assay results for each experiment are provided in Table 1. Despite feeding on a high ZIKV titer (â‰¥8 logs), only the positive control species Ae. aegypti became infected with and transmitted ZIKV.
